topic.name: Triangle Trigonometry
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Triangle Trigonometry in Mathematics

objectives.sub_topic_name: Applications in Real World Problems (Navigation, Surveying)
objectives.objective_text: Identify a map.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Applications in Real World Problems (Navigation, Surveying)
objectives.objective_text: Name North, South, East, West.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Applications in Real World Problems (Navigation, Surveying)
objectives.objective_text: Identify triangulation (finding a spot using two others).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Law of Sines and Law of Cosines (Non-Right Triangles)
objectives.objective_text: Identify triangles that are not 'perfect' corners.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Law of Sines and Law of Cosines (Non-Right Triangles)
objectives.objective_text: Name a wide triangle (Obtuse).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Law of Sines and Law of Cosines (Non-Right Triangles)
objectives.objective_text: Identify SAS vs. SSS cases.
Identify a triangle with a square corner.
Name the long side (hypotenuse).
Identify the Opposite and Adjacent sides relative to an angle.
Identify looking up (elevation) and looking down (depression).
Identify the right angle in real-world problems.
Identify a triangle with equal sides (Equilateral).
Name a 45-degree angle.
Identify symmetry in an equilateral triangle.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Applications in Real World Problems (Navigation, Surveying)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that sailors use math.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Applications in Real World Problems (Navigation, Surveying)
objectives.objective_text: Observe a compass.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Law of Sines and Law of Cosines (Non-Right Triangles)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that we can measure any shape.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Law of Sines and Law of Cosines (Non-Right Triangles)
objectives.objective_text: Observe different triangles.
Recall that shapes have sides and corners.
Observe a ramp (wedge).
Recall that we measure how high things are.
Observe shadows.
Recall patterns in shapes.
Defend the utility of exact irrational numbers.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Applications in Real World Problems (Navigation, Surveying)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize how to find distance without walking it.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Applications in Real World Problems (Navigation, Surveying)
objectives.objective_text: Explain bearings (direction in degrees).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Applications in Real World Problems (Navigation, Surveying)
objectives.objective_text: Draw a path given directions.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Applications in Real World Problems (Navigation, Surveying)
objectives.objective_text: Explain measuring the width of a river from the bank.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Applications in Real World Problems (Navigation, Surveying)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the historical importance of trig in exploration.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Law of Sines and Law of Cosines (Non-Right Triangles)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize that SOH-CAH-TOA only works for Right Triangles.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Law of Sines and Law of Cosines (Non-Right Triangles)
objectives.objective_text: Explain that we need new rules for other triangles.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Law of Sines and Law of Cosines (Non-Right Triangles)
objectives.objective_text: Draw the height (altitude) of a triangle.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Law of Sines and Law of Cosines (Non-Right Triangles)
objectives.objective_text: Explain solving for a missing side in an oblique triangle.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Law of Sines and Law of Cosines (Non-Right Triangles)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the Law of Cosines as a generalization of Pythagoras.
Summarize that the angle changes the side length.
Explain that similar triangles have the same shape but different sizes.
Measure the sides of a right triangle.
Explain why $tan(45) = 1$.
Defend the definition of trig functions as ratios.
Draw a line from the eye to a bird.
Summarize finding a missing side if we know the ratio.
Explain how shadows help measure tall trees.
Draw a diagram of a ladder against a wall.
Explain why the angle of depression equals the angle of elevation (alternate interior).
Defend the validity of the calculated result.
Cut a square in half to make two triangles.
Summarize that some triangles are special.
Explain an Isosceles Right Triangle.
Notice that in a 30-60-90, the short side is half the hypotenuse.
Explain deriving these from a square and equilateral triangle.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Applications in Real World Problems (Navigation, Surveying)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze bearings (e.g., N 30 E).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Applications in Real World Problems (Navigation, Surveying)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret vectors for wind and speed.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Applications in Real World Problems (Navigation, Surveying)
objectives.objective_text: Connect trigonometry to GPS concepts.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Law of Sines and Law of Cosines (Non-Right Triangles)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the area formula $Area = 1/2 ab sin(C)$.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Law of Sines and Law of Cosines (Non-Right Triangles)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret when to use Law of Sines (pairs).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Law of Sines and Law of Cosines (Non-Right Triangles)
objectives.objective_text: Connect the Law of Cosines to the Pythagorean Theorem.
Analyze the ratio of sides (Opposite/Hypotenuse).
Interpret SOH-CAH-TOA as a memory aid.
Connect ratio constancy to similar triangles.
Analyze word problems to draw the correct triangle.
Interpret inverse trig functions ($sin^{-1}$) to find angles.
Connect angle of elevation to height.
Analyze the ratio $1 : 1 : \sqrt{2}$ for 45-45-90.
Interpret the ratio $1 : \sqrt{3} : 2$ for 30-60-90.
Connect exact values to the Pythagorean theorem.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Applications in Real World Problems (Navigation, Surveying)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the impact of curvature on long-distance surveying.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Law of Sines and Law of Cosines (Non-Right Triangles)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the derivation of the Law of Sines.
Evaluate exact values for special angles.
Evaluate the precision of indirect measurement.
Evaluate expressions involving special angles.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Applications in Real World Problems (Navigation, Surveying)
objectives.objective_text: Construct a surveying plan for a plot of land.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Law of Sines and Law of Cosines (Non-Right Triangles)
objectives.objective_text: Construct solutions for the Ambiguous Case (SSA).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Law of Sines and Law of Cosines (Non-Right Triangles)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize navigation vectors with oblique triangle trigonometry.
Construct all six trigonometric ratios (sec, csc, cot).
Construct solutions for complex multi-step problems.
Construct exact trig values without a calculator.
Synthesize special triangles with the Unit Circle.
Synthesize algebraic manipulation with trig expressions.
Synthesize geometry proofs with trigonometric calculation.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Applications in Real World Problems (Navigation, Surveying)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize physics (force vectors) with trig applications.
